TopicTitle: I think i have a problem....

Articles.Content:
I cant stop adding mods to my game data folder, 70+ and counting..... Started at 50 when I started playing again.... Then I keep finding more, ooh piece of candy! On another note, the dreaded memory leak is back. I thought it had had been fixed? Any hidden gems (mods) anyone want to recommend?

- - - Updated - - -

Crap, might have wanted to post thus in add-on affairs... Please move thread if necessary.
What memory leak? If you're talking about - Game crashing with too many mods, that's not a memory leak. That's just a 32 bit executable.

I feel the same way every time Necrobones makes a new one....

Fortunately I have been able to limit myself to his fuel tank and fuel line mods...

> 
> What memory leak? If you're talking about - Game crashing with too many mods, that's not a memory leak. That's just a 32 bit executable.

There is definately a memory leak, i was flying a plane to the ice caps and slowly watching the RAM increase to the point i decided to save it and restart just incase of a crash.

My mods:

Asteroid day

Atomic age

Aviation lights

B9 proc wings

Ksprc

chatterer

CTT

Contract cfg

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-24T18:42:49Z" title="07/24/2015 06:42  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 24, 2015</time> by SmashBrown**
Hello my name is Nich, I am a KSPohlic lucky I have been able to avoid mods so far otherwise I know I would fall into a deep dark empty vacuum where no one can hear my screams

> 
> Thread moved.

banana's move me.

- - - Updated - - -

> 
> Hello my name is Nich, I am a KSPohlic lucky I have been able to avoid mods so far otherwise I know I would fall into a deep dark empty vacuum where no one can hear my screams

Step into the void... it's so... precious here.

> 
> -force-opengl is your friend

For whatever reason, antialiasing and that option don't play nice. I have it set for 8x, but it looks like there is none.

Use it in borderless windowed mode, also the full line should read "-force -opengl -poupwindow"

Then just press alt+enter.
